intro: Balsamita ageratifolia, commonly known as Mexican balsam or creeping balsam, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun. Balsamita ageratifolia is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and floral display.
